Posts.Content:
Hello,
My name is Pat and I have been a member of this forum for almost two years. I have prostate cancer (see my signature below). 
5 months ago my wife decided to cut out sugar from her diet and she has lost 30 lbs since then. As she lost the weight, she noticed a lump in her breast. The doctor looked at it and found a second one as well. Biopsy was yesterday and the doctor called today with the news - my wife has Invasive Ductile Carcinoma. 
This is tough, we have been dealing with my cancer and now this. It easier (in my limited experience) to be the one with cancer than the spouse - I don't like her being sick.
Surgeon calling tomorrow to set appointment for discussion. 
Thanks for your support,
Pat
55 years old, married 28 years, 2 adult children
Age at diagnosis 53 (2012)
PSA 3.6 2/09; 7.5 8/12; 6.1 9/12
Biopsy 1/12 positive Gleason 3 + 3 = 6 11/2012
Nerve sparing Robotic prostatectomy - cancer spread to bladder
removed prostate and most of bladder 1/2013
Pathology Gleason 3 + 4 = 7
PSA 4/13 <0.02; 7/13 <0.1; 10/13 <0.02; 2/14 <0.1; 5/14 <0.02
Next PSA Scheduled 8/14

Posts.Content:
